Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Interface IndexReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Resource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIndexReader, FulltextIndexReader, FusionIndexReader, GenericNativeIndexReader, IndexReader.Adaptor, NativeIndexReader, PartitionedIndexReader, SimpleIndexReader
    public interface IndexReader
extends Resource
    Reader for an index. Must honor repeatable reads, which means that if a lookup is executed multiple times the same result set must be returned.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      • EMPTY

    • Method Detail

      • countIndexedNodes

        long countIndexedNodes​(long nodeId,
                       PageCursorTracer cursorTracer,
                       int[] propertyKeyIds,
                       Value... propertyValues)
        Parameters:
        nodeId - node id to match.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        propertyKeyIds - the property key ids that correspond to each of the property values.
        propertyValues - property values to match.
        Returns:
        number of index entries for the given nodeId and propertyValues.

      • createSampler

        IndexSampler createSampler()

      • query

        void query​(QueryContext context,
           IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient client,
           IndexQueryConstraints constraints,
           IndexQuery... query)
    throws IndexNotApplicableKernelException
        Queries the index for the given IndexQuery predicates.
        Parameters:
        client - the client which will control the progression though query results.
        constraints - constraints upon the query result, like ordering and whether the index should fetch property values alongside the entity ids.
        query - the query so serve.
        Throws:
        IndexNotApplicableKernelException

      • hasFullValuePrecision

        boolean hasFullValuePrecision​(IndexQuery... predicates)
        Parameters:
        predicates - query to determine whether index has full value precision for.
        Returns:
        whether or not this reader will only return 100% matching results from query(QueryContext, IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient, IndexQueryConstraints, IndexQuery...). If false is returned this means that the caller of query(QueryContext, IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient, IndexQueryConstraints, IndexQuery...) will have to do additional filtering, double-checking of actual property values, externally.
